Class Ui

  • java.lang.Object
    • Ui
  • public class Ui
extends java.lang.Object
    The Ui class handles all user interactions and is responsible for returning the correct String representations of the output for the user.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Ui()

      Notifies the user of the Task removed.

    • Method Detail

      • showIntro

        public java.lang.String showIntro()
        Greets the users, and asks users what they want Duke to do.
        Returns:
        a String of Greetings.

      • showList

        public java.lang.String showList​(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
        Lists out all the tasks the user has added, be it ToDo, Deadlines or Events, in the order of input.
        Parameters:
        tasks - an ArrayList which consists of the Task objects
        Returns:
        a String representation of all Tasks in the list

      • showFarewell

        public java.lang.String showFarewell()
        Bids the user GoodBye after the user is done using Duke.
        Returns:
        a string of farewell words.

      • showTaskAdded

        public java.lang.String showTaskAdded​(Task t,
                                      TaskList list)
        Informs the user of the task added.
        Parameters:
        t - the Task to be added, which can be a ToDo, Deadline, or Event.
        list - the TaskList which contains all Tasks in the list.
        Returns:
        a String of information notifying the user of the added task.

      • showDone

        public java.lang.String showDone​(int n,
                                 TaskList list)
        Notifies the user of the task marked as done.
        Parameters:
        n - the task number, in the order of input.
        list - the TaskList which contains all Tasks in the list.
        Returns:
        a string to inform user of the task marked as done.

      • showDelete

        public java.lang.String showDelete​(int index,
                                   TaskList list)
        Notifies the user of the Task removed.
        Parameters:
        index - the task number, in the order of input
        list - the list from which the Task is to be deleted from
        Returns:
        a string to inform user of the task removed from the list

      • showData

        public void showData​(DukeData data)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Shows the user his data that is stored in the hard disk.
        Parameters:
        data - the DukeData object that stores the user's data from Duke program.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O Exception occurs.

      • addLines

        public static java.lang.String addLines​(java.lang.String cmd)
        Adds a line before and after every command.
        Parameters:
        cmd - the command output.
        Returns:
        a String representation of the output with the lines.
